name: Scribe Bowditch

topics.topic: AboutBrotherhood1Do you sell any specialty items?
topics.topic_text: Can you tell me more about the Brotherhood of Steel?
topics.response_text: Oh yes, I can. In fact, I suspect I could write several texts on the various details of the Brotherhood.

topics.topic_text: What are the central beliefs of the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid the answer to that is a lot more nuanced than others might suggest.

topics.topic_text: What have been the highlights of your time with the Brotherhood?
topics.response_text: I like to think that I've still got some big achievements left in me, although some of my joints seem to disagree these days.

topics.topic_text: What's the biggest challenge the Brotherhood has ever faced?
topics.response_text: It seems like whichever challenge we're facing is always the biggest one. Survival at first, then expansion, and now cohesion.

topics.topic_text: That's enough for now.
topics.response_text: Okay. Anything else?

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about the Outcasts.
topics.response_text: It's a rather sad story, I'm afraid. Last year, some of our soldiers had grave disagreements with the decisions of Elder Lyons.

topics.topic_text: What sort of disagreements did they have?
topics.response_text: Where Elder Lyons has fought to protect the people of the Capital Wasteland, the Outcasts demanded we move on and leave them to their fates.

topics.topic_text: Who were the exiles?
topics.response_text: The soldiers rallied behind Paladin Casdin, who was one of Elder Lyons' original squad. They served together for over twenty years.

topics.topic_text: What are you doing about them?
topics.response_text: As much as some of our soldiers would like to see them shot for deserting, there's not much we can do. We're too busy with the Super Mutants.

topics.topic_text: Enough about the Outcasts.
topics.response_text: It is a rather discouraging subject, isn't it?

topics.topic_text: It sounds like it was quite a loss. Is there any way to reconcile them?
topics.response_text: Lyons and Casdin would have to agree to any sort of reconciliation, and that's pretty unlikely. They're both quite proud and... stubborn.{Not entirely comfortable speaking ill of either of them}

topics.topic_text: If so many people agreed with him, maybe he has a good point.
topics.response_text: That's the thing, really. Casdin's "technology first" sort of attitude is more traditional in the Brotherhood always used to operate, out West.{Emphasis on the "IS" in "...sort of attitude IS more traditional"}

topics.topic_text: Well, good riddance to them. If you waver in your oaths, you get punished.
topics.response_text: You sound like some of the hard-liners. We all served together for years, but now some of the soldiers hate them as much as the Super Mutants.

topics.topic_text: What do you Scribes do?
topics.response_text: Why, a great many things!

topics.topic_text: That's all I needed.
topics.response_text: Very well.

topics.topic_text: Could you name the Orders?
topics.response_text: Of course. There's the Order of the Sword, Order of the Shield, and Order of the Quill.

topics.topic: CitScribeAboutWhatOrderWhat Order are you a part of?
topics.topic_text: Which Order do you serve, Squire Bowditch?
topics.response_text: I am Proctor of the Order of the Shield. I oversee the others in my Order, and make sure our defenses are up to snuff.

topics.topic_text: So... Any thoughts on the Enclave?
topics.response_text: The data you recovered gives our best chance at finishing the fight. I only hope we didn't miss anything in the decryption.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Hrm? Yes, hello. I've heard about you. We don't get many strangers here in the Citadel, especially those who walk about unescorted.

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about an android from the Commonwealth?
topics.response_text: Supposedly he needed facial reconstruction and memory wipe. At first we were thrilled about the idea of androids. Turns out it was just a hoax.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about the android from the Commonwealth?
topics.response_text: It's a hoax. Here listen to this "android recording." We analyzed it. That's clearly a human man speaking.{doubting the rumors}

topics.topic_text: You know anything about the mind wipe on that escaped android?
topics.response_text: Most believe it's a hoax. Here's some evidence for you to consider for yourself. Take this holotape.{bragging that he's in the know}

topics.topic_text: Got any info on an android mind wipe? Here's a 100 cap "research fee."
topics.response_text: Most believe it's a hoax. Here's some evidence for you to consider for yourself. Take this holotape.{bragging that he's in the know}

topics.topic_text: You know how they rewrote engrams in a cluster of Android memory subroutines?
topics.response_text: Most believe it's a hoax. Here's some evidence for you to consider for yourself. Take this holotape.{bragging that he's in the know}

topics.topic_text: Do you know who did the memory transfer on the escaped android?
topics.response_text: Normally I don't traffic in unsubstantiated rumor, but... they say old Pinkerton is hiding out somewhere in Rivet City and that he did it.{bragging that he is in the know}

topics.topic_text: I'll give you 100 caps if you know who did the mind wipe on that android.
topics.response_text: Normally I don't traffic in unsubstantiated rumor, but... they say old Pinkerton is hiding out somewhere in Rivet City and that he did it.{bragging that he is in the know}

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about the AI swap on that Commonwealth android?
topics.response_text: Normally I don't traffic in unsubstantiated rumor, but... they say old Pinkerton is hiding out somewhere in Rivet City and that he did it.{bragging that he is in the know}

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: I'm trained in resisting all forms of coercion. You're wasting your time.{doesn't think the player is worthy of the information, or can be trusted with it}

topics.topic_text: So... Any thoughts on the Enclave?
topics.response_text: They're sporting some pretty impressive Power Armor, I'll give them that. The Advanced Mark II.

topics.topic_text: Care to share anything about the Super Mutants?
topics.response_text: They're relentless. Like nothing I've ever seen before. I honestly think they see our Brothers in Power Armor as some kind of... canned meal.

topics.topic_text: Could you repair my equipment?
topics.response_text: I suppose that I can. The Brotherhood can make use of Wasteland currency to trade.

conversation.response_text: Ah... you're a bit early today, sir. Regardless, I'm happy to report that the development of the Mark II Recon Armor unit is proceeding as planned.
There may be a slight delay in the enhancement of the ambulatory gyroscope. A few of the parts I need were lost in the recent... inventory reduction.
Thank you, sir. I appreciate it.
It is, Scribe Peabody. Thank you.

description:
Scribe Bowditch is a 62 year-old African American Male.

Scribe Bowditch is a senior member of the Brotherhood of Steel serving as the Proctor of the Order of the Shield and Lead Scientist at the Citadel. He was the mastermind behind transforming the ruins of the Pentagon into the Brotherhood's fortified headquarters, designing its iconic crane-operated outer gate. Despite his advancing years, Bowditch remains dedicated to his duties and hopes to accomplish one more significant achievement before passing his responsibilities to a younger scribe. He is a respected scholar among the Brotherhood, possessing unparalleled knowledge of their history and traditions.

Scribe Bowditch's Personality: Knowledgeable, methodical, and somewhat nostalgic. Bowditch values order, security, and the preservation of Brotherhood traditions above all else. He has a pragmatic approach to challenges but occasionally reflects fondly on his more adventurous youth, though he admits that being shot at during those excursions were career low points.

Scribe Bowditch's Backstory: Born in the year 2215, Scribe Bowditch joined the Brotherhood of Steel as a young initiate and quickly distinguished himself with his technical aptitude and strategic thinking. He rose through the ranks, eventually becoming a key advisor in the Brotherhood's East Coast operations. When the Brotherhood established their new headquarters at the Citadel, Bowditch was instrumental in its design and fortification, earning him the prestigious role of Proctor of the Order of the Shield. Over the decades, he has dedicated himself to preserving the Brotherhood's history and ensuring the Citadel's defenses remain impregnable.
